name: Mark Edwards
background: Mark Edwards serves as Commissioning Editor, Culture and Society at ARTE France. Focus areas: Arts, culture, society. They are looking for: Premium arts docs with cinematic approach; European identity; social docs with artistic vision.
thematic_priorities: Premium arts docs with cinematic approach
premium documentary content with European cultural relevance
feature-length documentaries (52–90 minutes) with strong artistic vision
creative documentary approaches that push boundaries
cultural documentaries exploring European identity and perspectives
social documentaries with intellectual depth and artistic treatment
historical documentaries with fresh intellectual perspectives
science documentaries combining intellectual depth with visual innovation
arts documentaries on major cultural figures or movements
target_audience: Culturally engaged audiences in France and Europe
format_specifications: Preferred Lengths: Singles 52–90'; series 3–6×52–60' (features 90' where noted)
Scheduling: Primetime/flagship slots where applicable; platform premieres for streamers
Typical Episode Counts: 3–10 for series, depending on strand
budget_parameters: Documentary: €200K–€400K per hour; Specialist Factual: €220K–€450K per hour
technical_requirements: Delivery Specifications: Broadcast/streaming standards; details provided upon commissioning
Accessibility: Subtitles/captions; audio description per broadcaster requirements
Graphics & Branding: Adherence to broadcaster branding guidelines
current_calls: Reflect latest broadcaster priorities as outlined above; commissioner-specific interests included.
submission_process: 3–5 page treatment with premise, approach and artistic vision
additional_info: Emphasis on diverse voices on- and off-screen. Encouragement of sustainable production practices. Support for projects across French regions (where applicable). Open to pitches from independent producers/companies.
